description: Dive into "Dubrovnik's Coastal Bliss: Beach Vibes Await" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Dubrovnik's Coastal Bliss: Beach Vibes Await

places.generalDescription: Sunset Beach Dubrovnik, located just 2.5 kilometers from the Old City of Dubrovnik in Lapad bay, offers a perfect blend of nature-inspired design and Mediterranean flavors for a relaxing day-to-night experience. With luxurious sunbeds and VIP cabanas on its pebble and fine sand beach, it's an ideal spot to unwind. The club also provides a picturesque setting for weddings amidst olive trees and the sea's soothing ambiance.

sources.snippet: As its name suggests, Sunset Beach is famed for its spectacular sunset views, providing the perfect backdrop for a variety of activities throughout the day. Whether you’re starting your day with a delicious morning coffee, enjoying a leisurely family lunch or unwinding in the afternoon with a cocktail while lying on a sun lounger, Sunset Beach is perfect for all moments. As the evening sets in, the atmosphere becomes even more vibrant with quality DJ music playing under the starry sky.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Dubrovnik | Valamar

sources.snippet: Very popular for a vacation in Dubrovnik is the Sunset Beach, also known as Uvala Lapad Beach. It is located on the peninsula of Lapad, which is the famous tourist center of the coastal metropolis. This charming pebble beach with fantastic sea colors is located in a long bay, where you can also find other great swimming opportunities.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Stunning Beaches in Dubrovnik

places.name: Sunset Beach Dubrovnik

reviews.text: A small beach in Lapad. Beautiful sea water, lots of restaurants around the area to chill and enjoy the panaromic view. There's a trail with many spots along the cliff to hangout.

Beautiful views and they have done amazing work on the walk way but there was a whole pile of rubbish that was on the beach for the five days that we were there. Bins overflowing and it wasn't peak season. Shops behind beach were empty and quite run down. Dissapointing on what is a lovely spot. Lots of building work going on nearby so maybe it will improve when this is all completed.

Clear water, safe swimming - it's lovely.  There is the occasional sea urchin but it's not as bad as it sounds. Pebble beach means water shoes are a must.

There are plenty of bars/shops/restaurants around all contending to take as much money from you as possible, which accounts for only 4 stars.

Do stay, or go back at sunset and the hour afterwards,  it is stunning. Put your phone on 'night mode' for the best pictures

places.generalDescription: Bellevue Beach is a hidden gem nestled in a picturesque bay, embraced by steep cliffs and rocky bluffs. Just a short 20-minute stroll from Dubrovnik's Old Town, this charming pebble beach offers an ideal escape for those seeking peace and solitude. Accessible via stairs near the Hotel Rixos Libertas, it attracts both locals and visitors alike with its inviting waters perfect for swimming and sunbathing.

sources.shortName: 15 Amazing Beaches in Dubrovnik You Must Visit

sources.snippet: Nestled in a deep, scenic bay enclosed by steep cliffs and a large cave, Bellevue beach is one of the best Dubrovnik beaches for those who love tranquility and isolation. Located around 20 minutes walk from the Old Town right at the beginning of the Lapad peninsula, the beach is accessed by a stairway close by the Hotel Rixos Libertas. The pebbled shore is popular among locals and is also a great spot for cliff jumping.
sources.shortName: Dubrovnik Beaches - Where to Find Best Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Bellevue Beach is a hidden gem located in the picturesque Gorica, in Miramare Bay, just a short 20-minute walk from the Old City. This secluded pebble beach is nestled in a deep bay surrounded by steep cliffs, offering stunning views and a peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. Access to the beach is via steps alongside Hotel Rixos Libertas or by taking the Bellevue Hotel’s elevator.
sources.shortName: Best 50 beaches in Dubrovnik and the area

sources.snippet: If you don’t want to travel too far, Bellevue Beach is located in the heart of Dubrovnik, making it an easy spot to access. This stunning bay sits below Hotel Bellevue and displays vistas comprising rugged cliffs, shimmering waters and pebble sand. Bellevue Beach is also a great spot for adventure seekers as there are plenty of cliff diving and snorkelling opportunities here.
sources.shortName: The 9 Most Beautiful Beaches in Dubrovnik, Croatia

sources.snippet: When I first visited Dubrovnik, I was thrilled to discover Bellevue Beach, one of the city's best-kept secrets. Known locally as Miramare, this stunning beach is tucked away just a short walk from the city center—less than a mile from Pile Gate. To get there, you’ll need to descend a steep set of steps at the back of Hotel Bellevue, but the journey is well worth it.
sources.shortName: The 7 best beaches in Dubrovnik in 2025

sources.snippet: One of the probably most beautiful bays in this region is the Bellevue Beach, directly in the city of Dubrovnik, just below the Hotel Bellevue. The descent over the steep steps right behind the hotel already offers a breathtaking view!. An absolute dream beach awaits you here, surrounded by steep cliffs, with stunning crystal clear water and fine pebbles.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Stunning Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Just below the Hotel Bellevue this pebbly beach is partially managed by the Hotel Bellevue but is also popular with locals. The high cliffs on each side shade the beach in the afternoon and provide a scenic backdrop to local water polo tournaments. Watching the various Dubrovnik teams try to outdo each other provides a wonderful window into local life.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Bellevue Beach, also known as Miramare is located in Miramare Bay (uvala Miramare) is just on 20 minutes walk from the Old Town on the very beginning of Lapad peninsula. It is a secluded pebble beach that one can get to via steps that lead along the side of Hotel Rixos Libertas. The beach is nestled in a deep, picturesque bay surrounded
sources.shortName: Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Secluded in Miramare bay, Bellevue Beach is popular with locals for cliff jumping and water polo. Its southeast orientation offers plenty of shade in the afternoon if you’re looking to avoid the intense summer heat, with the surrounding cliffs and adjacent cave providing a picturesque setting.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Dubrovnik Beaches Worth Visiting

sources.snippet: Bellevue Beach is a stunning wide beach below Hotel Bellevue, about a 20-minute walk from Dubrovnik Old Town. It is a pebble beach which also has some large rocky areas in the water. There are quite a few stairs to get down to the beach, but there is a restaurant/facilities once there.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches In Dubrovnik Croatia + Map

sources.snippet: Bellevue Beach is situated deep within Miramare Bay on the edge of Lapad Peninsula. To reach the shingle and sand beach, follow the steps by the Hotel Rixos Libertas that weave down the cliffside. It’s steep, with no other access for those with difficulty walking.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: { MAP} This popular Dubrovnik beach is situated under a towering rocky bluff and can get crowded in peak season. The pebble beach can be tricky to find and is accessed via a steep staircase after a 30 minute walk from the old city.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Dubrovnik Beaches for your Croatia Vacation

places.name: Bellevue Beach

reviews.text: Great little beach. Currently blocked off but you just go past the barrier in the photo below. Nice a quiet because of that I think. Really nice spot

There is a cave that leads to a submerged white sand beach inside where you can stand. Very cool! It would be five stars if there were less trash on the beach. It is not catastrophic, but one person cleaning in a few days per month can DRAMATICALLY improve the experience.

Dubrovnik city, do something!!!

Bellevue Beach is nice for a quick swim with clear water and dramatic cliffs. It's pebbly, so bring water shoes. Gets crowded during the day and access is a bit steep so definitely not for someone who finds it challenging to scale the side of a gate. Not the best in Dubrovnik, but worth a visit if you're nearby.

places.generalDescription: Coral Beach Club Dubrovnik, located on the Lapad Peninsula, offers a luxurious and relaxing setting to enjoy stunning sunsets and refreshing cocktails. With panoramic views of the Adriatic Sea, this upscale venue provides a sophisticated beach club atmosphere. It is highly regarded for its crystal-clear sea, Ibiza music, Dalmatian lifestyle, and Mediterranean delicacies. The beach club stands out with its unique design and first-rate amenities, including an open-air restaurant shaped like a shell.

sources.snippet: Days at the seaside don’t come hipper than the Coral Beach Club, a luxurious hang-out with perfectly sculpted sandbanks and well-preened palm trees. Set on the west coast of Babin Kuk, the beach is dotted with white lounge chairs, and pricey cocktails are de rigueur, while Scandinavian techno faintly patters in the background.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches In And Around Dubrovnik, Croatia

sources.snippet: Set in the stunning area of Babin Kuk, the Coral Beach Club is a picturesque retreat that combines the natural beauty of Dubrovnik with upscale beach amenities and a vibrant atmosphere. Known for its crystal-clear waters and breathtaking views of the islet of Daksa, this beach has earned its reputation as one of Dubrovnik’s top beach destinations. Whether you’re lounging under the sun, sipping on a refreshing cocktail or indulging in Mediterranean delicacies, the Coral Beach Club promises an unforgettable beach experience.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Dubrovnik | Valamar

sources.snippet: Coral Beach is not your average beach – it’s a sensory experience that combines luxury and relaxation with entertainment and adventure. Enjoy your favourite beach activities, indulge in spa treatments, and savour excellent dining options while soaking up the stunning views and exceptional electronic music that permeates the air. The beach features a wooden deck with comfortable lounges under palm trees, perfect for taking in the surroundings.
sources.shortName: Best 50 beaches in Dubrovnik and the area

sources.snippet: If you are looking for a shore with sophisticated and luxurious hang-out space, consider visiting Coral Beach Club, just around 10 minutes walk from the Copacabana beach Dubrovnik. With perfectly set sandbanks, palm trees, dozens of comfortable lounge chairs, and a bit overpriced cocktails, Coral Beach Club has an ideal spot for relaxation among other Dubrovnik beaches.
sources.shortName: Dubrovnik Beaches - Where to Find Best Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: If you’re looking for a lively spot to relax with a cocktail in hand, Coral Beach Club is the place to be. I was immediately drawn to the iconic beach bar and the stunning curved pier, flanked by palm trees and the most incredible azure waters. Nestled between Copacabana and Sunset beaches, Coral Beach Club has a private feel—though it’s absolutely open to the public.
sources.shortName: The 7 best beaches in Dubrovnik in 2025

sources.snippet: A fancy beach club located between Sunset and Copacabana beaches, Coral Beach Club is a fancy beach bar with a lovely beach, great views, comfortable loungers, food and drinks service, and non-stop music. There is a small pier from where people jump and rocky shores just next to the beach. This is a good beach in Dubrovnik for young groups and couples.
sources.siteName: Croatia Travel Guide and Consultation Services for Croatia
sources.shortName: Where To Swim In Dubrovnik Croatia

sources.snippet: For a touch of luxury and exclusivity, indulge in the Coral Beach Club experience. With its pristine sands and VIP amenities, it’s a haven for those seeking a refined beach escape. Enjoy the sun-drenched paradise while sipping on refreshing cocktails, making it an unforgettable addition to your Dubrovnik beach itinerary.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Dubrovnik? - updated 2024
15 Amazing Beaches in Dubrovnik You Must Visit

sources.snippet: Over on the Lapad Peninsula, Coral Beach Club offers a more polished beach day experience. Daybeds, DJs, and full food and drink service right on the water. It’s a bit of a splurge, but if you want to post up somewhere all day with comfort and an elevated vibe, this is the spot.
sources.shortName: Top Beach Hotels, Beach Bars, & Swim Spots (2025

sources.snippet: Probably one of the most beautiful beaches is located at the Coral Beach Club on the Lapad peninsula. A young and hip crowd meets here to spend unforgettable summer days in an exclusive atmosphere. A small, cozy paradise has been created on this gorgeous pebble beach.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Stunning Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Coral Beach is a beach club not too far from Copacabana Beach. There is free entry but you have to pay to rent chairs/umbrellas. As it’s a beach club, there are plenty of facilities, like bars and restaurants.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches In Dubrovnik Croatia + Map

places.name: Coral Beach Club Dubrovnik

reviews.text:
What an amazing location! Idyllic, peaceful, beautiful. Because if that, it is a short walk from where you would be dropped off.

The beach is small rocks, not sand, so be prepared with footwear.

Food wise left a lot to desired for the price. We were recommended to get the pizza but they aren't serving it this month (May). The rest of the food options were overpriced and average. The same goes for drinks, although a bottle of wine to split could be justifiable.

Me and my girlfriend had an amazing day here. We wanted a chill day away from the hustle and bustle of Dubrovnik, and coral beach club was just the ticket. The chill house music vibes from the DJ's were good and we had the views to match. All the food and drinks we had were top notch and really good quality. Big shout out to our server, Egor. He made our day perfect and his service to us was incredible. Highly recommend this place!

We had the absolute best experience at this beach club! The service we received was unmatched anywhere else during our entire tour of Europe. Our server went above and beyond in every way-he was incredibly attentive, always checking in at just the right time, and made us feel completely taken care of. On top of that, he was so friendly and easy to talk to, which made the whole experience even more enjoyable. Truly the best service we've had on our trip, and we couldn't be happier. Highly recommend! ASK FOR MARIN!!!

places.address: Ul. Ivana pl. Zajca 30, 20000, Dubrovnik, Croatia

places.generalDescription: Uvala Lapad Beach is a popular waterfront destination in Dubrovnik, Croatia. It offers a mix of sand and pebbles, creating a comfortable spot to spend the day by the shimmering blue sea. The beach provides facilities such as beach chairs and umbrellas, and there are bars and restaurants nearby for refreshments. Visitors can enjoy stunning views of the surrounding hills and islets while relaxing on this pet-friendly beach.

sources.snippet: Lapad (bus no. 6 from Pile) has a family-friendly public beach complete with showers, sunloungers and shallow waters overseen by lifeguards. Behind, the pedestrianised shade of Šetalište kralja Tomislava has a bouncy play area and tennis courts are nearby. Immediately to the west, the rocks beside the Niki i Meda Pucića promenade allow for nude sunbathing.
sources.shortName: The best Dubrovnik beaches | Croatia Travel

sources.snippet: If you’re hoping to get out of Dubrvonik’s Old Town to explore more of the area, a trip to Uvala Lapad is a great option. The lovely mix of sand and pebbles creates a comfortable beach to spend the day, the sea shimmers shades of blue under the sun and there are also some great facilities nearby. Be sure to check out the bars and restaurants near the beach, a great place to grab a bite to eat or a drink for those spending the day at Uvala Lapad.
sources.shortName: The 9 Most Beautiful Beaches in Dubrovnik, Croatia

sources.snippet: With its shallow waters and a promenade lined with cafes and ice cream parlors, it’s a haven for both relaxation and entertainment. The beach exudes a laid-back charm that perfectly complements the azure Adriatic lapping at its shores. All commercial facilities at Sunset beach are temporary closed due to business licensing problems (updated in Spring of 2024).
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Dubrovnik? - updated 2024

sources.snippet: Uvala Lapad, also known as Lapad Bay is located in the buzzing urban area between the Petka hills and Babink Kuk. This gorgeous bay boasts several pebble beaches that stretch along the coast, with clear turquoise waters that are perfect for a refreshing swim. The light fine pebbles also mean that you can leave your clunky shoes behind and enjoy being barefoot.
sources.shortName: Best 50 beaches in Dubrovnik and the area
15 Amazing Beaches in Dubrovnik You Must Visit

sources.snippet: Lapad Beach is a pebble beach located right at the end of the pedestrian street (Šetalište kralja Zvonimira) in Lapad. It’s in a great location and there are plenty of restaurants around, the closest probably the Sunset Beach Bar. It’s a great beach for families, watching the sunset, and for people who don’t want any stairs to access the beach.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches In Dubrovnik Croatia + Map

sources.snippet:
The Lapad peninsula boasts a stretch of well-tended pebbles that extends from the Hotel Splendid to the Hotel 
 Kompas along Lapad bay ( uvala). Uvala Lapad is the largest beach in town and the easiest to access. Facing directly west, this is a great beach to catch the afternoon rays and then watch the sunset.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Uvala Lapad, or Lapad Bay Beach, is a popular Dubrovnik beach surrounded by hotels, bars, and a restaurant. It’s one of the best beaches for families with children since it has so many water sports and facilities. That said, it can get very packed during the summer so it’s not exactly the peak of relaxation.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Dubrovnik Beaches Worth Visiting

sources.snippet: One of the best beaches in Dubrovnik is Uvala Lapad, especially for relaxation. This beautiful pebble beach also offers much more than just the beach. You’ll find many restaurants, bars, and hotels, and there is a lovely promenade to walk on.
sources.shortName: Dubrovnik Beaches - Where to Find Best Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Located in Lapad Bay, Lapad Beach, also known as Sunset Beach, is the largest beach in Dubrovnik. As its name implies,  this is an excellent beach in Dubrovnik for sunsets. The beach is partly pebble, partly cemented, and rocky.
sources.siteName: Croatia Travel Guide and Consultation Services for Croatia
sources.shortName: Where To Swim In Dubrovnik Croatia

sources.snippet: { MAP} Uvala (also called Sunset Beach Dubrovnik) is the main beach in Lapad. The shore is pebble, but there are lounge chairs available for rent. Additionally, there’s a nearby waterpark and playground for the little ones.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Dubrovnik Beaches for your Croatia Vacation

sources.snippet: Shallows overseen by lifeguards are safe for children to splash around in, while you’ll find a shady soft play area on the pedestrianised Šetalište kralja Tomislava. Sunloungers dot the sand, and there are showers too.
sources.shortName: The 7 Best Beaches In Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: To reach this beach take bus no 2 to Uvala Lapad and get off at the bus stop at Hotel Park, or take no 6 to Bulevar and then take first. Read more » Uvala Lapad Beach
sources.shortName: Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Located on Lapad Peninsula on the northern fringes of the Eastern European city, Uvala Lapad is a picturesque crescent-shaped beach with glistening water.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Beaches in Dubrovnik

places.name: Uvala Lapad Beach

reviews.text: It is very beautiful beach with crystal clear water. Lots of cafés. Restaurant and supermarkets near by. Love this place wanna come again.

I can really recommend this beach. It is huge and even with many people there is spreads out really nicely with a second beach right next to it. The bar or whatever it is that is separating the two beaches seems to be permanently closed.
The water is really clear as always in Croatia. Once you step inside the water after about 5 meters there is sand and you can walk quite easily pretty far into the water as it is only slightly sloping.
Would definitely come back!

Lovely pebble beach and a great spot to watch sunset but all the facilities around it are closed down in peak season (Aug 2025) so there is no option to rent sunbeds, no public toilet and nowhere at the beach itself to buy food or drink. There is a supermarket close by and a street full of bars and restaurants also near to the beach but everything at the beach itself is not open.

places.generalDescription: Beach Sunj is a small and secluded sandy beach located on the opposite side of the island from the port. It can be reached by a 25-30 minute walk or a quick 3-4 minute golf buggy ride. The beach offers low-key restaurants and rentals for lounge chairs and umbrellas. The shallow waters make it perfect for swimming, especially for kids, and it's an ideal spot to relax with beautiful views.
places.name: Beach Sunj

reviews.text: The best beach in Dubrovnik. Nice, hot sandy beach, surrounded by beautiful hills. You can take a ferry to the island and catch a caddy ride to the beach, or if you book a private boat trip, they bring you close to shore and then you can jump off and swim/walk to shore. Good drinks from bars on the beach, plus a gorgeous restaurant up on the hill on the right side.

Visited this beach as part of a trip and spent about just under 2 hours here . It's a beautiful beach in a little cove . You can use some of the sunbeds if you buy drinks or food from one of the bars on the beach. The sea is lovely and very shallow for quite a bit .

With many boat trips they bring you here to stay 1.5 hours, You can then use the beach beds for free if you order something to drink this costs 6 euros for a coke and 16 euros for a cocktail, so very expensive.

The beach is beautiful and nice warm water because it is shallow and it is a sandy beach no stones

places.generalDescription: Plaža Sveti Jakov is a secluded beach located in a picturesque cove, accessible via stairs leading down to the sandy shore. Visitors can enjoy the serene atmosphere and stunning views of the Old Town from this hidden gem. The beach offers a cafe and bar for refreshments, adding to the overall experience. Additionally, nearby attractions such as Betina Cave Beach and Hotel Belvedere provide alternative options for exploration and discovery.

sources.snippet: A little way past Banje but still less than a 25-minute walk from the Old Town, this local favorite is set below cliffs and is accessed by a flight of steps leading down from the Sveti Jakov Church. The alluring stretch of shingle and pebble beach has sun-loungers for rent, and there’s a restaurant, bar, and toilets. Like Banje, it also has stunning views of the Old Town.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Local residents and in-the-know visitors steer towards Sveti Jakov, a picturesque walk along a pine-fringed boulevard, just 20 minutes from Banje. Located near Hotel Villa Dubrovnik, the gorgeous, panoramic view stretches right over the Old Town and Lokrum Island. A blend of sand and shingle, Sveti Jakov is a bit more rugged than the city beach.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches In And Around Dubrovnik, Croatia

sources.snippet: On our last trip to Dubrovnik, we stumbled upon Sveti Jakov Beach—and it’s been one of our favourite finds ever since. Just a 25-minute walk or a quick bus ride from Dubrovnik Old Town, this stunning beach is tucked away between dramatic cliff faces, creating a peaceful escape from the city’s hustle and bustle. The moment you arrive, the pebble-covered shore and crystal-clear turquoise water make it feel like your own private slice of the Adriatic.
sources.shortName: The 7 best beaches in Dubrovnik in 2025

sources.snippet: Tucked away in a serene cove, Sveti Jakov Beach offers a peaceful escape from the busy streets of Dubrovnik. Located just 1 km south of the Old Town, this secluded sandy and pebble beach is favourite among locals and tourists alike due to its stunning views and a relaxed atmosphere. Accessible by a series of steep steps, the journey down to the beach offers breathtaking vistas of Dubrovnik’s Old Town and the enchanting island of Lokrum.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Dubrovnik | Valamar

sources.snippet: Absolutely unique in Dubrovnik is the Sveti Jakov Beach, which has already been chosen by several magazines as one of the most beautiful beaches in Croatia. And really, you will experience an absolute dream beach, surrounded by spectacular rocks and with a breathtaking view of the city of Dubrovnik. While swimming in the crystal clear waters, you’ll enjoy fantastic turquoise blue sea colors and top quality water at its best.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Stunning Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: If you are looking for a secluded beach away from the hustle and bustle of the city, do not miss the beach Sveti Jakov, one of the most attractive beaches in Dubrovnik. It is located in a small bay below the church of St. James, and the road to it leads up steep stairs, as many as 160, so it is not suitable for the elderly. It is about half an hour's walk from the Old Town.
sources.shortName: Find out all about the most interesting Dubrovnik Beaches

sources.snippet: Sveti Jakov Beach is a hidden gem in Dubrovnik, located about a 20-minute walk or a short drive from the Old Town. Nestled beneath cliffs, this secluded beach offers stunning views of the city walls, Lokrum Island, and the Adriatic Sea. The beach is a mix of pebbles and sand, with crystal-clear waters perfect for swimming and snorkeling.
sources.shortName: The 9 Most Beautiful Beaches in Dubrovnik, Croatia

sources.snippet: The stunning Sveti Jakov Beach is one of the most beautiful swimming spots along Dubrovnik’s coast. This captivating pebble beach is just a stone’s throw away from the old city and boasts a breath-taking, almost surreal scenery. With turquoise waters and fine pebbles surrounded by an imposing rocky landscape, it’s no surprise that Sv.
sources.shortName: Best 50 beaches in Dubrovnik and the area

sources.snippet: Get away from the crowds and enjoy gorgeous views of Lokrum Island at Sveti Jakov Beach. Dubrovnik’s city beaches can get pretty crowded during high season so check out this local favourite. If you’re up for a bit of a trek, Sveti Jakov is a quieter beach with scenic panoramas of Old Town and the Adriatic Sea.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Dubrovnik Beaches Worth Visiting

sources.snippet: An ochre-hued cliff flanks this pebbly half-moon bay with Mediterranean trees hugging each side of the rock face, just a short drive from the center of town. There’s a stone-built beach bar carved into one side of the cove and a range of thatched and purple-colored umbrellas for hire.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Beaches in Dubrovnik
15 Amazing Beaches in Dubrovnik You Must Visit

sources.snippet: Escape the crowds and discover the secluded beauty of Sveti Jakov Beach. Tucked away beneath lush greenery, this hidden gem provides a more intimate beach experience. The gentle waves and panoramic views create a serene escape, perfect for a romantic day by the sea.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Dubrovnik? - updated 2024

sources.snippet: Sveti Jakov is a more secluded beach, but it’s still pretty popular. It’s a very pretty pebble beach area below cliffs, so there are quite a few stairs to get down, but it’s definitely worth it. The water here is a beautiful blue colour and really clear to swim in.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches In Dubrovnik Croatia + Map

sources.snippet: Sveti Jakov Beach, one of the most beautiful beaches in Dubrovnik is located in the eastern part of Dubrovnik Town in the tiny bay offering a distant look to the Lokrum and Old Town. It is situated about a mile away from the Old Town. Read more » Sveti Jakov Beach
sources.shortName: Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: You can find Sveti Jakov beach to the south of Oldtown, far away from the crowded streets. The Adriatic view from here is also breathtaking, but the most significant advantage of the place is that it is much quieter than the beaches nearby.
sources.shortName: Beaches of Dubrovnik - Top 10 Sandy, Rocky and Pebble Beaches

sources.snippet: A post shared by ALEX 🌊📍Blogger in Dubrovnik (@the_mindful_mermaid) on Apr 29, 2018 at 11:21am PDT. How to get there: 15 minute walk from the Old Town
sources.shortName: 15+ Best Dubrovnik Beaches, As Told By a Local

places.name: Plaža Sveti Jakov

reviews.text: An absolute hidden gem next to some of Dubrovnik's bigger beaches but this was by far, the best! It's quite steep to get to with a 5 minute walk down various stairs from the top of old town but well worth it. Lovely azure water, sunbeds that you can rent for €25 each (all come with umbrellas), a bar and restaurant and good music beach played throughout. It looks crowded but plenty of space for everyone. Was so glad that TikTok helped us come across this!

Chose to spend a guilt free beach day here on our last day in Croatia. Did not disappoint! Got to the beach for 10 30 and easily got a spot in the second row. Sunbeds were nice and comfy and 25 euros each for the day (15 extra for an umbrella) which didn't feel too bad. After spending lots of days swimming in more quiet spots straight off the rocks (as we don't like loud busy beaches), this delivered a nice change in scene. The beach was busy by midday but not so much that it ruined the relaxed atmosphere, and the size of it feels very intimate, with the palm fronded beach bar giving it an almost tropical feel. The beach bar does great burgers and various other bar snacks such as fried fish and calamari and salads, although the salads looked a little basic. There is also one proper beach restaurant on the other side of the beach. The water was very calm too. If you're looking for a proper beach day with all the works but without the obnoxiously loud music and crowds, this is the perfect spot!

Lovely hidden beach with lounge rentals and umbrellas (65 euro for 2 w umbrella) Bar, cafe, and restroom available. Less crowded than by Dubrovnik wall but many steps down and pebble beach, bring water shoes. Lovely day!🏖️

places.generalDescription: Beach Šulić, also known as Kolorina, is a hidden gem located in the neighborhood Pile near Dubrovnik's Old Town. Nestled under the Lovrejenac fortress, this picturesque pebble and sand beach offers a magnificent view of the historic castle and the turquoise waters of Croatia. Despite its popularity among locals and being featured in Game of Thrones scenes, Beach Šulić remains uncrowded, providing visitors with a peaceful and pleasant swimming experience.

sources.snippet: Nestled in the picturesque cove of Kolorina, just a stone’s throw away from Dubrovnik’s historic city walls, Šulić Beach is a secluded pebble oasis cherished by those in the know. This hidden gem has gained prominence for its appearances in the iconic “Game of Thrones” series. Its unique location offers stunning views of the sea, the majestic Lovrijenac Fortress to the east and the lush Gradac Park atop the cliffs on the west side.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Dubrovnik | Valamar

sources.snippet: The small Šulić Beach is located in the neighborhood Pile, very close to the Old Town and is a top bathing spot on the list of the best beaches in Dubrovnik. This little gem is picturesquely located under the Lovrejenac fortress, and so you can enjoy a magnificent view of the historic castle while swimming. Thanks to its hidden location, Šulić beach is never crowded, which guarantees a pleasant swim in a spectacular setting.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Stunning Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: This beach is one of the best hidden places to swim and only 5 minutes outside of the Old Town, behind the Lovrijenac Fortress.You can choose between sitting on the pebbled beach and swimming from the concrete area. What I love about this beach the most is that there is a beach bar next to it that has swings, called Beach Bar Dodo. It’s one of my favorite places to have drinks while taking in the gorgeous view.
sources.shortName: 15+ Best Dubrovnik Beaches, As Told By a Local

sources.snippet: Even though it’s so close to Dubrovnik Old Town, it’s a little hidden so it’s not too overcrowded. Sulic Beach is only small, with a small pebble area, and some concrete areas around the sides. So there’s not a lot of ‘beach’ area to lay out your towels or sit, but many people just spread out there towels on the concrete area around it too.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches In Dubrovnik Croatia + Map

sources.snippet: { MAP} Tucked into a deep cove just west of the old city, Sulic Beach is a real gem. Towering cliffs rise up from both sides and the stoic Fort Lawrence (King’s Landing from Game of Thrones) sits atop one ledge. The beach is pebbly and not that big, but it’s also not as popular as Banje, so there will likely be fewer people.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Dubrovnik Beaches for your Croatia Vacation

sources.snippet: Pronounced as “shoo-lich, “it is also referred to as Kolorina beach because of its location in Kolorina bay, just outside of City Walls. The beach is one of the oldest compared to other Dubrovnik beaches and a favorite spot for locals. Due to its location, it is also famous among those who come on a day trip to Dubrovnik.
sources.shortName: Dubrovnik Beaches - Where to Find Best Beaches in Dubrovnik
15 Amazing Beaches in Dubrovnik You Must Visit

sources.snippet: Sulic Beach is made up of pebbles and sand, alongside Croatia’s classic turquoise waters. The whole area is breathtaking with rugged cliffs in the backdrop and dazzling coastal vistas. This provides the ideal place to relax and unwind whilst taking in Croatia’s impressive seaside.
sources.shortName: The 9 Most Beautiful Beaches in Dubrovnik, Croatia

sources.snippet: If you'd rather stay downtown but want to avoid the crowds, visit Suluci Beach. The sea is crystal clear, and fewer tourists visit it. The surface of the narrow little bay is gravel, surrounded by concrete on two sides.
sources.shortName: Beaches of Dubrovnik - Top 10 Sandy, Rocky and Pebble Beaches

sources.snippet: Sulic Beach is only 400 m or a 5-minute walk from Dubrovnik’s old town. Along with Banje and Dance, it is the closest beach to the old town. This small hidden beach is a real gem popular among locals.
sources.siteName: Croatia Travel Guide and Consultation Services for Croatia
sources.shortName: Where To Swim In Dubrovnik Croatia

sources.snippet: Sulic is the closest beach to Dubrovnik's old town, lying just outside Pile Gate and below Fort Lovrijenac. Remember the Battle of the Blackwater (season 2 episode 19) in Game of Thrones?
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: This was by far the best beach in Dubrovnik, at least in our opinion!. We actually stumbled on this beach as we were wandering aimlessly outside of the city walls one day.
sources.shortName: 3 of the Best Dubrovnik Beaches Near Old Town

places.name: Beach Šulić

reviews.text: Great little spot for a dip. There is the beach walk in, there is stairs to walk in or jump off and there is a ladder also. Plenty of options for all. There is also a beach bar and amenities.

Super easy location from Old Town, wasn't sure what to expect but small beach, really all pebbles really crowded but end of July, it was a great spot for a dip and the Dodo Bar was open (not as cute and fun looking as it maybe once was but serves alcohol!) - Enjoyed time in the water, sipping a spritz with some amazing views. Worth checking out.

A hidden gem just steps from the Old Town! Beach Šulić is a small, peaceful cove with crystal-clear water and a relaxed vibe. Perfect for a refreshing dip after exploring the city. You can walk straight into the sea, jump off the rocks, or use the ladder-there's something for everyone. There's even a beach bar nearby and basic amenities like showers and toilets. It gets busy in the afternoon, so come early if you want a quieter experience. A must-visit for anyone looking to unwind by the water in Dubrovnik

places.generalDescription: Banje Beach, also known as Plaza Banje, is a stunning beach in Dubrovnik, Croatia. It offers a picturesque view of the medieval Old Town against the turquoise ocean. Just a short walk from Ploce Gate, it's easily accessible for visitors exploring the area. However, it can get crowded during peak summer season. For a more peaceful alternative, Sveti Jakov Beach is nearby.

sources.snippet: Close to Ploče Gate (also known as Vrata od Ploča), Banje – the best-known of Dubrovnik‘s public beaches – is a great option for families. With loungers and parasols on offer, this pebble and sand beach is located just a few minutes’ walk from the historical centre, boasting an impeccable view of the Old Town. For anyone looking for a more energetic beach outing, it’s possible to go waterskiing and wakeboarding, or to rent kayaks.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches In And Around Dubrovnik, Croatia

sources.snippet: Just a hop and a skip from the harbor, this popular pebble beach has stunning views of the Old Town, and plenty of facilities including restaurants and sun-loungers. This is Dubrovnik’s main city beach, so it’s also enormously popular – meaning it’s best to get here early before it fills up. It’s good for families, and in the evening transforms into a lively beach bar and party spot.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Perhaps the most famous beach in Dubrovnik is Banje Beach, a pebble beach with some rocky sections, where even the Blue Flag flies. It is perfectly located right next to the historic old town, and while swimming in the clear sea you can enjoy a fantastic scenery with a view of the city walls, the old port and the island of Lokrum. Along this stretch of coast, the sea shimmers in the most beautiful turquoise colors, creating a spectacular contrast with the red roofs of the city center.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Stunning Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: We are sure that you have come across the photos of this beach each time you googled ''Dubrovnik'', right?. Banje Beach is located on the edge of Dubrovnik’s Old Town alongside the 17th century Lazareti and in front of the eastern entrance to Dubrovnik Old Town (Ploče Gate). Repeatedly listed as one of the most beautiful beaches in Europe and the world, it offers a fantastic view of the city port and the island of Lokrum.
sources.shortName: Find out all about the most interesting Dubrovnik Beaches

sources.snippet: Banje Beach is one of the most iconic Dubrovnik beaches, with pebble and rocky parts, and crystal-clear waters, it is a sight to behold. Located right next to the historic old town, it provides a unique experience where you can enjoy in the beautiful scenery while taking a dip in the refreshing sea. You’ll be treated to a jaw-dropping view of the city walls, the old port, and the island of Lokrum.
sources.shortName: Best 50 beaches in Dubrovnik and the area

sources.snippet: Banje beach is probably one of the most famous Dubrovnik beaches, and there are plenty of reasons for it. It is also one of the most amazing beaches in Croatia. It’s right next to the Old Town, so close that you can see the walls while you sunbathe; it doesn’t get more dazzling than to swim in the Adriatic Sea with privileged views of the most beautiful city in Croatia.
sources.shortName: Dubrovnik Beaches - Where to Find Best Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Banje Beach is one of Dubrovnik’s most popular, and busiest, beaches, located just a short walk from the city’s iconic Old Town and Ploce Gate. It offers stunning views of the ancient city walls and the nearby island of Lokrum. The beach features a mix of pebbles and sand, and its crystal-clear waters make it ideal for swimming and water sports.
sources.shortName: The 9 Most Beautiful Beaches in Dubrovnik, Croatia

sources.snippet:
Banje Beach is close to the Old Town and has an amazing view 
 of Dubrovnik's walls. It can be extremely crowded in the summer however which is why locals tend to avoid it. Banje beach is easy to find: just head east out Ploce gate and walk 10 minutes along the coastal road to a flight of steep stairs that takes you down to the beach.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Picture yourself with toes in the sand and the medieval city walls as your backdrop – that’s Banje Beach. Just a stone’s throw from the Old Town, it’s the ideal spot to soak up the sun, take a dip, and savor the captivating views of Dubrovnik’s iconic skyline. Google maps location: https://maps.app.goo.gl/pARQbcmoNUmP6CMy7
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Dubrovnik? - updated 2024

sources.snippet: Located just outside the Ploče gate of the Old City walls, Banje beach is one of Dubrovnik’s most popular beaches. It’s a beautiful pebbly beach that will provide you an unforgettable view of the Old Town of Dubrovnik. You can enjoy this fantastic cityscape view while sunbathing or even sipping on a cocktail.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches to Visit In and Around Dubrovnik
15 Amazing Beaches in Dubrovnik You Must Visit

sources.snippet: Banje Beach lies a mere stone’s throw away from Dubrovnik harbour. Its convenient location makes it the perfect place to pop for a quick dip while exploring the city. A pebble beach, you won’t need to worry about the sand getting stuck in your toes in this little haven.
sources.shortName: The 7 best beaches in Dubrovnik in 2025

sources.snippet: This was by far the best beach in Dubrovnik, at least in our opinion!. We actually stumbled on this beach as we were wandering aimlessly outside of the city walls one day. We happened to be in Dubrovnik on a double cruise ship day, which meant everything was packed.
sources.shortName: 3 of the Best Dubrovnik Beaches Near Old Town

sources.snippet: With a beautiful view over Dubrovnik Old Town,  Beach Banje is located in front of the eastern entrance (Ploče Gate) to Dubrovnik Old Town.The beach is situated on the seashore of hotels Excelsior and Argentina. (click for large photo of. Read more » Banje Beach
sources.shortName: Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: The most famous and popular beach in Dubrovnik is Banje beach. You may have seen it on countless postcards, as this is where most pictures are taken of the Oldtown of Dubrovnik (it is only 100 meters away). Bring only a towel; you can rent a sunbed here!.
sources.shortName: Beaches of Dubrovnik - Top 10 Sandy, Rocky and Pebble Beaches

sources.snippet: Banje Beach is one of the most popular beaches in Dubrovnik, and for good reason. It’s walking distance from Dubrovnik Old Town, just outside of Ploče Gate. You can swim in clear blue water whilst looking back at the Old Town and the city walls.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches In Dubrovnik Croatia + Map

sources.snippet: One of the most popular Dubrovnik beaches, Banje Beach boasts gorgeous views of Old Town and nearby Lokrum Island. It can get very crowded in the summertime but is still one of the best beaches near Dubrovnik.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Dubrovnik Beaches Worth Visiting

sources.snippet: Like most Dubrovnik beaches, Banje features a mix of shingle, stone, and sand with a shallow shoreline. Banje’s upscale beach club is popular for its lively DJ sets, Mediterranean fare, and delicious drinks.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Banje Beach is the most popular beach in Dubrovnik, especially among tourists. Its location is spot on!. Banje is the closest beach to the old town, only 350 m from the Ploce Gate, or about a 4-minute walk.
sources.siteName: Croatia Travel Guide and Consultation Services for Croatia
sources.shortName: Where To Swim In Dubrovnik Croatia

sources.snippet: Banje beach is in close proximity to the Old City walls, providing a beautiful view of the city ramparts. Covered in pebbles, it offers a variety of water sports including sand handball and water-polo.
sources.shortName: Beaches of
15+ Best Dubrovnik Beaches, As Told By a Local

places.name: Banje Beach

reviews.text: Banje Beach is a must-visit if you're in Dubrovnik! It's just a 10-minute walk from the Old City, super convenient. The views are stunning, and the water is crystal clear-perfect for a relaxing swim. One tip: definitely bring beach slippers, as the beach is quite pebbly and can be a bit tough on bare feet. I had such a great time here-relaxing, swimming, and soaking up the sun. Highly recommend!

Small rocky beach with some areas of small pebbles that are easier to sit or lay on.  The beach is free with a restaurant close by for drinks that you can enjoy on the beach.

Great beach and beautiful views.

Banje Beach and Bar is a must-visit in Dubrovnik! Located right on the water, it offers fantastic seating areas for lounging and tables for delicious meals. Seriously, grab some ice cream and fruit – highly recommend! Yes, it can get a bit crowded with tourists during high season, but that's totally expected. Despite the crowds, the stunning location and offerings make it absolutely worth the visit.

places.generalDescription: Lokrum is an essential stop for anyone exploring Dubrovnik. This small island, just a short boat ride away from the city's old harbor, offers a blend of natural beauty and cultural heritage. Visitors can wander through pine woods, explore a botanical garden with exotic plants, stroll along shaded paths, and enjoy stunning views of Dubrovnik and the open sea. The island also features an old Benedictine monastery that now houses a restaurant, adding to its historical charm.

sources.snippet: Accessed by a cheap and quick taxi boat from the harbour beside Dubrovnik’s Old Town, Lokrum offers a whole island’s worth of hidden coves and secret beaches. Few have names, and signposting is minimal, but all can be reached by paths and trails that you’ll find if you follow your way through Lokrum’s verdant hinterland. Just be aware that some beaches (such as HKK on the island’s southeastern corner) are naturist.
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches In And Around Dubrovnik, Croatia

sources.snippet: The little island of Lokrum, just a 15-minute boat ride from the Old Town, has a rocky shoreline which makes for some lovely swimming spots. There’s also a shallow saltwater lake in the centre of the island, if you want something a little less rugged and rocky – the high salt content has earned it the nickname of the Dead Sea Lake. The southern part of the island is a naturist beach.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Mysterious-looking Lokrum Island sits sprawled in front of the Dubrovnik Old Town harbor, and within an easy reach. Connecting the Old Town and Lokrum Portoč harbor, public boats run on a regular and frequent schedule, bringing you to the island in a short, 15-minute ride. Lokrum visitor’s center is situated in Portoč harbor and provides all the information you might need to make the best of your visit, plus some lovely and unique souvenirs.
sources.shortName: Dubrovnik Beaches

sources.snippet: The next beach on our list is located on the small island of Lokrum, only 10 minutes by boat from Dubrovnik. What is unusual about this beach is the fact that it is a lake called "The Dead Sea''. Due to the clean and warm water which is shallow enough (the lake is 10 meters deep), it is a great spot for families with children and non-swimmers. ''The Dead Sea'' beach on Lokrum island, source: Flickr
sources.shortName: Find out all about the most interesting Dubrovnik Beaches

sources.snippet: Lokrum Island quickly became one of my favorite escapes from the bustling Dubrovnik Old Town. Just a 15-minute boat ride from the city center, Lokrum feels like a world away, offering a peaceful retreat amidst lush botanical gardens and roaming rabbits and peacocks. As I wandered around the island, I was captivated by its natural beauty and tranquil atmosphere.
sources.shortName: The 7 best beaches in Dubrovnik in 2025

sources.snippet: The tiny islet and lush nature reserve of Lokrum is known for its ruined Napoleonic fort and peacock-guarded botanical gardens. However, few people know of its dramatic coastline – best explored by kayak. Some of the leading companies offering kayaking tours are Kayak Tours Dubrovnik or Adventure Dubrovnik.
sources.shortName: The 7 Best Beaches In Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Lokrum is the closest island to Dubrovnik and a must-visit place to explore during your visit to Dubrovnik. The island has plenty of areas to sunbathe, swim, and relax. However, most of them are rocky and ideal for cliff jumping.
sources.shortName: Dubrovnik Beaches - Where to Find Best Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Take a ferry from the Sponza Palace side of the city center and enjoy a relaxing 10-minute ride across the water to reach Lokrum Island, a protected nature reserve. A ferry service runs every 30 minutes from 10 a.m.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Beaches in Dubrovnik

places.name: Lokrum

reviews.text: Lokrum or lokrum island is a natural reserve located right off the coast of Dubrovnik. It has a monastery, a beautiful forest and a botanical garden. There are a couple of restaurants too on the island. There are a lot of peacocks roaming almost everywhere on the island. The monastery has a couple of beautiful filming locations for the popular GoT series. The island is serviced by a ferry which leaves Dubrovnik harbour every 30 mins.

It is an island some 15 minutes away (1km)from dubrovnik. You can book tickets online (lokrum webshop)or just walk up to the old town pier(turning left from the supposedly beat gelato shop.
Ticket kiosk is on the right after the restaurant seating. The boat is brown and white called the zrinski.
Carry some sandwiches and beer from the store before the entrance if you want or there are plenty of nice restaurants on the island.
It is a beautiful island with lots of trees and shade. Star attraction is the stunningly beautiful peacocks walking around and are comfortable in your presence.Dont feed them and dont touch them please.  You can check out the monastery(not functional) but you have a nice looking restaurant here and the iron throne where you can sit on and take pictures . A bit of a steep climb on a stony broken path to the right to the ruins of the small fort and nice views. Do check out the corner bench next to the exit with the best view. Then back down to the monastery( you can use the lavatory here if you want) towards the small water body where you can swim if you want. You can play volleyball and football as it has option for both and of course play zone for little kids.
Plenty of areas on this island where you can go down the steps to the water.
Took us some 4hrs back to the pier in dubrovnik.
You can take maybe 5-6hrs if you want to picnic sitting on the benches near the monastery or eat at the restaurants.
While sitting on the benches peacocks do come looking for food but keep it high on the benches. Dont feed them.They just hover around and dont say anything.
Overall keep this for the last day as a filler.

Great place to visit.
beautiful island with great history.
amazing places to swim.
easy to spend a day there .
and I got to sit on the Iron throne (from game of thrones)
great views of Dubrovnik.
cafes and nice places to sit and enjoy a drink.

places.generalDescription: Copacabana Beach, situated on the Babin kuk peninsula, offers a pleasant beach experience with options for both public and private areas. Visitors can rent sun loungers or canopies, enjoy water sports, get a relaxing massage, or sip cocktails at the beach bar and restaurant. The public section features a bar and an inflatable water park in the sea, perfect for children's entertainment.

sources.snippet: Located on the northern shore of the Babin kuk peninsula at Seka Bay, the chic Copacabana is rather smaller than its Brazilian namesake – but is still a good spot for a swim, sunbathing and enjoying that requisite cocktail. You’ll find a small armada of white sun-loungers and cabanas, and a gentle arc of pebble beach – and there’s a restaurant and bar. You can keep busy here by renting jet-skis here, getting a massage and renting sports equipment.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: A half-moon of pebbles and gravel set in Seka Bay, Copacabana is one of Dubrovnik's best beaches. Studded with luxury white loungers and deckchairs, there's heaps going on to keep you amused with watersports, paddle boarding and inflatables for the kids. The beachside restaurant provides further inducement to spend the day here with breakfast, lunch and dinner covered.
sources.shortName: The best Dubrovnik beaches | Croatia Travel

sources.snippet: Copacabana Beach, situated on the scenic peninsula of Babin Kuk, is a versatile beach destination that caters to a wide array of preferences, from serene relaxation spots to vibrant activity zones. This beach, known for easy access and ample parking, is divided into a public area and the exclusive Copacabana Beach Dubrovnik. With its stunning views of the islet of Daksa, the Elaphiti Islands and the impressive Dubrovnik Bridge, Copacabana Beach offers an idyllic setting for a day by the sea.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Dubrovnik | Valamar

sources.snippet: Located in the Babin Kuk area, just beneath the hotel Valamar Club Dubrovnik, Copacabana Beach is a nice pebbly beach in a sheltered bay. There is an attractive beach bar at one side with fancy deck chairs and private white cabanas, towel service, sun umbrellas, DJ music, and unfortunately shaky service and overpriced drinks, food, and rental equipment. Copacabana Beach is the place to be if you want to see and be seen, sip cocktails, and party.
sources.siteName: Croatia Travel Guide and Consultation Services for Croatia
sources.shortName: Where To Swim In Dubrovnik Croatia

sources.snippet: This half-moon-shaped, sandy, and pebbled beach located on Lapad Peninsula is another great choice when looking at Dubrovnik beaches. Famous for turquoise-colored sea, Copacabana beach Dubrovnik is a favored place for locals and visitors who love cocktails, parties, private huts, and fresh smoothies. You’ll most likely find a DJ spinning tunes to ensure a nice beach party right at the shore.
sources.shortName: Dubrovnik Beaches - Where to Find Best Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Copacabana Beach is a vibrant, family-friendly beach located on the Babin Kuk peninsula, offering a mix of pebbles and concrete sunbathing areas. It provides stunning views of the Elaphiti Islands and Dubrovnik’s iconic bridge. Known for its calm, shallow waters, Copacabana is ideal for swimming and water sports like kayaking and jet skiing.
sources.shortName: The 9 Most Beautiful Beaches in Dubrovnik, Croatia

sources.snippet: Copacabana beach is one of the most beloved family summer destinations in Dubrovnik. Situated on the Lapad Peninsula, it offers numerous summer activities and water sports all day long. This pebble covered beach is suitable for the disabled persons; it is equipped with the special elevator providing easy access to the sea.
sources.shortName: Beaches of

sources.snippet: Northwest of Dubrovnik, Copacabana beach wraps around Seka Bay, on the Babin Kuk peninsula. It’s one of the best beaches in Dubrovnik for all the family, with parachute boat rides, pedalos, jet skis, water chutes, and banana boats. There are canoes for a gentler way of tracing the coastline.
sources.shortName: The 7 Best Beaches In Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: This beach is a place where both locals and tourists come to enjoy their summertime. It’s a great place if you want to combine relaxation and a bit of fun. The beach is located in the part of Dubrovnik called Babin Kuk, which is only a short distance away from the Old Town.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches to Visit In and Around Dubrovnik

sources.snippet:
No, it will not remind you of Rio, but this is a perfectly 
 pleasant beach on the Babin Kuk peninsula. It's a 
 great family beach because the water is relatively shallow and there's an inflatable waterpark that kids will love. Also, it's an easy beach to access.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: When we went to Copacabana Beach, it seemed really popular with families. There is a huge carpark and camping grounds nearby, and a couple of restaurants here. You also don’t need to go down any stairs to access the beach.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches In Dubrovnik Croatia + Map

places.name: Copacabana Beach

reviews.text: Nice little beach. More of a relaxing space to be in, than a beach to enjoy. We had really great drinks here. Good view of the water, and other side of Dubrovnik.

Beautiful pebble beach.
You can rent beach chairs or beds but they are quite pricey, for a bed we paid €75 euro a day. Cabanas were 150 euro.
Good and drinks at the bars are also expensive but the beach is beautiful and water refreshing. They also have inflatable water attractions for kids at 14 euro per hour.

A very touristy beach. My boys loved jumping off the peer into the water. There is a water park and lots of cabanas. Beach is close to a holiday park. I only scores 3 starts because I prefer less touristy places.

places.address: Ul. Ivana pl. Zajca, 20000, Dubrovnik, Croatia

places.generalDescription: Blaze Beach, also known as Buza Beach, is a hidden gem within the old town walls of Dubrovnik. Accessible through a single small doorway in the wall, this secret beach offers a unique and refreshing swimming experience after exploring the Old Town. The cliff-side bars and steps leading into the sea make it an ideal spot for sunbathing and sea diving.

sources.snippet: A tiny beach in the Old Town of Dubrovnik’s very heart, Buža Beach, lies just outside of the City Walls. You can get there via a small doorway—the door of St. Stephen—which opens up to a rocky ledge underneath the walls. Without question, one of the coolest and best Dubrovnik beaches in the Old Town, Buža, is near the Dubrovnik Cathedral, showing just how accessible it is.
sources.shortName: 16 Amazing Dubrovnik Beaches - Croatia Beach Guide

sources.snippet: If you are looking for attractive and best Dubrovnik beaches, make sure to check out Buža Beach, offering stunning views of the Adriatic Sea and Lokrum Island. The area is rocky with several concrete terraces where you can sunbathe painlessly or jump into the sea. Buza beach is an ideal place to watch the sunset, as the horizon turns into a red and orange color palette.
sources.shortName: Dubrovnik Beaches - Where to Find Best Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: This beach is not really a beach but rather a series of cliffs and cemented platforms with metal ladder stairs that ease access in and out of the sea. However, it’s another convenient place for a quick dip in the Adriatic while roaming Dubrovnik’s old town. Have a drink in the popular cliff bar of the same name once you get out of the water.
sources.siteName: Croatia Travel Guide and Consultation Services for Croatia
sources.shortName: Where To Swim In Dubrovnik Croatia

sources.snippet: Buža Beach is one of Dubrovnik’s most unique spots, offering a blend of adventure and romance nestled at the foot of the city’s southern walls. The name “Buža” translates to “hole” in the local dialect. It describes the entrance through an opening in the ancient walls that leads visitors to this hidden coastal treasure.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Dubrovnik | Valamar

sources.snippet: If you haven’t already heard of them, they are little bars that you access through little doors, or quite literally holes in the city walls. There are seats on rocky areas near the water, and you can swim off the rocks if you choose. So it’s not a traditional beach, but a rocky area you can swim off.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches In Dubrovnik Croatia + Map

sources.snippet: { MAP} Of the two Buza Bars in Dubrovnik, the Mala Buza Bard Bar is also another place to swim along the walls. Again, be sure to check the railings and ladders before entering the water and you will also be expected to purchase something from the bar itself.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Dubrovnik Beaches for your Croatia Vacation

sources.snippet: The beach is perhaps not the best word for this stretch of coast, as it is more of a series of rocks and concrete surfaces with metal steps in places that make it easier to approach the sea. The place is beautiful, as it lies directly under the castle wall.
sources.shortName: Beaches of Dubrovnik - Top 10 Sandy, Rocky and Pebble Beaches

sources.snippet: Buža Beach is, in my opinion, one of the most attractive swimming and sunbathing spots in Dubrovnik. It is a pretty unconventional place, located right next to the southern edge of huge Town Walls, offering great views of Lokrum Island and Adriatic.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: It's more a place for a quick dip rather than a place to hang out in comfort. To get there from the old town climb up any of the streets behind the Cathedral and look for the ‘Cold Drinks’ sign. It’s literally a hole in the wall.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Dubrovnik

places.name: Buža Beach

reviews.text: Not sure if we can call it a beach but it's really nice spot to sit, drink, watch people jumping or Lokrum island
Loved it, had a lot of fun with the family here jumping from the rocks.  Bar serves cold beer perfect for the hot weather.

The best swimming spot within the Dubrovnik city walls, cash only, 6.50 euro a bottle of beer or cider, you can walk into the water with the use of a ladder, or jump off the many available rock jumping locations. Fun or relaxing is entirely your choice. If the tables are used up which they are most of the time as it is quite a small bar, just wait around for 10mins and something should free up.

places.address: Dubrovačke Gradske Zidine, Crijevićeva ul. 9, 20000, Dubrovnik, Croatia

sources.snippet: Take the coastal walk a kilometre or so east of Copacabana and there's pebbly Mandrac beach near the Solitudo Sunny Camping and Mobile Homes. Much of the beach is devoted to the guests of the campground but there's also a public portion. Lounge chairs and umbrellas are available to rent at a reasonable price from a small stand that also serves up drinks and snacks.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Dubrovnik

places.name: Mandrač Beach

reviews.text:
Stumbled across this on the setnica walking trail.

Nice pebble coast line. A lot of boats are docked here but there are some areas that are designed for swimming. You will see lots of cruise ships passing/docked.

Free parking was noted. Seems like a family friendly beach with a small dog beach not too far away.

Mandrač beach is a nice beach however we found it had some downsides. Because of where it's located it takes longer to get to, and once you're there, there is very little shade or shelter to cool off in. It's also very exposed because of its location on the coast, meaning there's a constant breeze and the sea is slightly colder and choppier.

It does have nice features, there is a small play area which would be nice for families with small children, and the views are lovely. It also had a shower which was free to use

Great beach, calm city beach with both locals and tourists 😇💗💖🌈easy going entrance into the sea 🌸🍀💐clear sea, constant breeze and life guard on the beach 😍🌹💖
Also there are beds with umbrellas to rent with fair prices: 2  beds+umbrella 30 euro (August 2025). Also there is a green area and beach bar 🌈💓and free parking by the beach 🌸loving it🍀💖🍀

places.address: Ul. Ivana pl. Zajca 39, 20000, Dubrovnik, Croatia

places.generalDescription: Plaža Danče, also known as Danče Beach, is a hidden gem favored by locals in Dubrovnik. Tucked away down a small track, this rocky shore offers privacy and tranquility for those seeking a peaceful seaside retreat. The deep waters are perfect for swimming and snorkeling, while the ancient church of Sv Marija nearby adds a touch of history to the visit.

sources.snippet: Located at the foot of the historic monastery complex and the Church of St Mary, just 200 metres from Dubrovnik’s Old Town, Danče Beach is a destination steeped in local tradition. Known as one of the oldest beaches in Dubrovnik, it holds a special place in the hearts of locals, especially due to its association with the city’s beloved water polo. Danče Beach offers a unique experience of swimming in deeper and slightly colder waters, making it a favourite among experienced swimmers and those seeking a more adventurous dip in the sea.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Dubrovnik | Valamar

sources.snippet: Dance Beach is favoured among locals and is tucked away down a small track, perfect for those seeking a little privacy when spending the day at the seaside. Its rocky shore provides a pretty place to relax for the day and the deep water here is ideal for those looking to swim and snorkel. There’s also the ancient church of Sv Marija near the beach, providing a great way to soak up some history when visiting here.
sources.shortName: The 9 Most Beautiful Beaches in Dubrovnik, Croatia

sources.snippet: Danče is the oldest and probably most authentic beach that Dubrovnik has to offer—conveniently located near the Pile entrance to the Dubrovnik Old Town. This beach is an excellent choice if you want to submerge yourself into the local culture of Dubrovnik. Still this rocky beach is a local favorite due to its authenticity and natural look.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches to Visit In and Around Dubrovnik
15 Amazing Beaches in Dubrovnik You Must Visit

sources.snippet: One of the most popular and best beaches in Dubrovnik is the rocky shore known as Danče Beach. Offering stunning turquoise-color water and sunbathing terraces, it is just a 10-minute walk west of Pile Gate. Even though it’s very close to the Old Town, it’s a perfect place to escape the hustle of the Old Town and enjoy the tranquility.
sources.shortName: Dubrovnik Beaches - Where to Find Best Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Dubrovnik’s oldest beach Danče is hidden just west of the city down a short track from Gradac Park. It’s a mostly rocky shore beach with a roped off area for deep water swimming. The beach boasts stunning views of the old Franciscan monastery and Gradac park.
sources.shortName: Best 50 beaches in Dubrovnik and the area

sources.snippet: Danče (pronounced: dan-che) is one of the oldest beaches in Dubrovnik and is very popular with locals. It is located in Danče bay, about 5 minutes west of the Old Town. The beaches have several large rocks and jetties for sunbathing as
sources.shortName: Beaches in Dubrovnik

sources.snippet: Danče Beach is a hidden gem where locals take early-morning swims. While there is no sand, a scattering of flat rocks offers sunbathing spots. However, the main draw is the aquamarine water that laps the rocky cove.
sources.shortName: The 7 Best Beaches In Dubrovnik
3 of the Best Dubrovnik Beaches Near Old Town

places.name: Plaža Danče / Danče Beach

reviews.text: The water was really nice, and as a fan of rock beaches compared to sand beaches, it was definitely my all-time favorite beach! Myriad of fish with a gorgeous rainbow fish that I think was an Ornate Wrasse, but I'm still unsure...  I would definitely recommend this to everyone except anyone who doesn't know how to swim. It is very deep from the very beginning, so there are no shallow areas for beginner swimmers.
Visited during spring time. Lovely & quiet spot to enjoy sunset. Rock beach ⛱️ should be quite a hyped spot during summer, free shower & plenty of space to sunbath.

Beautiful beach area not far out of the city with many areas to sit and enjoy the sun and swim.

About a 15 minute walk from the Pile Gate, along the water to a fantastic swimming and sunning area.  Many flat places to sit or lay on a towel along with rocky areas that provide places to sit or jump off the rocks into the water.

The views are amazing, quite a different area than the crowded downtown center.

If you are in town for a few days and need a break, take the walk to Dance Beach, it's worth the walk

places.generalDescription: Nestled on the eastern side of Dubrovnik, Croatia, Betina Cave Beach is a hidden gem known for its white pebble shoreline and enchanting underwater cave system. Accessible only by sea, this secluded beach offers a picturesque setting and serves as an ideal escape from the more crowded beaches in the area. Visitors can explore the Betina Sea Cave and watch kayakers making their way there, with opportunities for cliff jumping for the adventurous spirits.

sources.snippet: The secluded Betina Cave Beach is a real insider tip among the best hidden beaches of Dubrovnik. This beach jewel is located just north of the Old Town and can only be reached by sea, i.e. by kayak or boat. Upon arrival, definitely you will be amazed by the unique beach scenery, as this magical natural bay is surrounded by a rocky cave covered with pine trees.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Stunning Beaches in Dubrovnik
15 Amazing Beaches in Dubrovnik You Must Visit

sources.snippet: If you’re seeking more of the hidden beaches near Dubrovnik, Betina Beach Cave is the place for you!. This secret cave provides the perfect place for all to get out and enjoy an adventure whilst visiting here. It is located close to the city walls and can be accessed by a sea kayaking tour from the town.
sources.shortName: The 9 Most Beautiful Beaches in Dubrovnik, Croatia

sources.snippet: Betina, better known among tourists as a Cave Beach, is a small cave beach, only reachable from the sea. This is the most unusual beach in Dubrovnik. The cave makes it nice and cool even during the hot summer days (this beach gets only a few hours of sun a day).
sources.siteName: Croatia Travel Guide and Consultation Services for Croatia
sources.shortName: Where To Swim In Dubrovnik Croatia

sources.snippet: Betina Cave is a pebble beach only a kilometer and a half away from the Old Town of Dubrovnik. This unusual secret beach is located directly in the rock and can only be reached by the sea - by boat or kayak. You can also take water taxis in the Old Town port.
sources.shortName: Find out all about the most interesting Dubrovnik Beaches

sources.snippet: Located just south of the Old Town, in between Banje and Sveti Jakov, Betina Cave Beach is what you might call a hidden gem. And this is not a figure of speech. It’s actually hidden in an impressive rock cave and only accessible by boat or sea kayak.
sources.shortName: 16 Amazing Dubrovnik Beaches - Croatia Beach Guide

sources.snippet: { MAP} Only accessible via boat, Betina is located inside a shallow cave along the eastern shoreline. Although it is mainly a pebble beach, there is a small patch of sand. There are no facilities, but cliff-jumping and snorkeling are possible.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Dubrovnik Beaches for your Croatia Vacation

sources.snippet: A little different from the other best beaches in Dubrovnik, Betina Cave is a hidden marvel. Set below a massive rocky cave, the beach is breezy and shady. If you’re in search of unique destinations in Dubrovnik, add Betina Cave to your list!
sources.shortName: 16 Best Dubrovnik Beaches Worth Visiting

places.name: Betina Cave beach

reviews.text:
Well worth a visit. You can rent kayaks from the old town, which is around 30 minutes of easy paddling to get here.
There's loads of fish in the shallows, and the water is stunning.
Accessible by kayak:boat. It's a cave, but nothing special. Only worthwhile if you want to swim. Lots of jelly fish in April (mating season).
A fantastic adventure kayaking yhe Croatian waters. Sebastian was brilliant too! Thank you.

places.generalDescription: Banje Beach Restaurant Lounge & Club is a versatile venue located alongside the Old Town Port, offering a beach club during the day, transforming into a waterfront restaurant in the evening, and then turning into a vibrant nightclub at night. It boasts stunning views of the Adriatic Sea and the harbor from its terrace. The restaurant serves Mediterranean cuisine with Dalmatian flavors using fresh seasonal ingredients from local producers. With an elegant decor and chic ambiance, it attracts locals, international business people, and celebrities alike.

sources.snippet: { MAP} Stylish, hip and fun, Banje Beach is the most popular Dubrovnik, Croatia beach for good reason. Located just outside the Ploce Gate, it’s easily accessible via a 5 minute walk. The idyllic spot offers incredible views encompassing the Dubrovnik Old Town, Lokrum Island and the crystal clear, blue sea.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Dubrovnik Beaches for your Croatia Vacation

sources.snippet: If you want to combine beach lounging with a party atmosphere, Banje Beach Club is the place to go. It’s a classic beach bar by day and a full-on beach club by night. You get front-row views of Dubrovnik’s city walls and Lokrum Island, plus easy access to the sea.
sources.shortName: Top Beach Hotels, Beach Bars, & Swim Spots (2025

sources.snippet: Banje is the closest beach to the city, just a short walk from Ploče Gate. It’s mostly pebbly, with crystal-clear shallows that are ideal for children to play in. There are jet skis and inflatables, plus showers.
sources.shortName: The 7 Best Beaches In Dubrovnik
16 Amazing Dubrovnik Beaches - Croatia Beach Guide

places.name: Banje Beach Restaurant Lounge & Club

reviews.text: Loved Banje Beach! Cozy atmosphere , beautiful sea view over the islands and the picturesque old town which was also a short walking distance from the beach. Service was amazing, The staff in both the restaurant and on the beach is super friendly and helpful. The restaurant offers amazing food and refreshing drinks with table service by the sunbeds. Small pebble stones and a little plateau from where you can jump makes the beach a perfect place for all ages (we were there with 2 small kids). We enjoyed it several days in a row and can't wait to come back🏖️☀️❤️

Dubrovnik was absolutely beautiful. Such an interesting history. After taking in the sights it was a short walk to Banje beach club. We were greeted immediately and sat at table close to the beach so our daughter could enjoy the beach while we dined. Our server Milan was gracious. He made us feel so welcomed. I had the sea bass, my husband had the burger. It was all so delicious. Thank you Milan for your hospitality.

Lovely beach club with wonderful, friendly staff. Beds are so comfy and luxurious. Water is crystal clear and refreshing after laying in the sun. Ice cold drinks served straight to your bed. We are on a cruise and came here for the day whilst docked in Dubrovnik. Incredible views from water and calm, peaceful atmosphere. We would definitely recommend and would come back again! Thank you Banje beach club :)
